com.google.gwt.user.client.dnd
Class MouseDragGestureRecognizer

java.lang.Object
  com.google.gwt.user.client.dnd.MouseDragGestureRecognizer
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.MouseListener, java.util.EventListener
public class MouseDragGestureRecognizer
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.MouseListener

Class where all the different listeners are fired by the MouseListener.
It's also the gesture of all Drag and Drop behavior.
You can manage every functions from an external class.
For example, on a mouse move, we'll move our Widget and fire the onDragMouseMove listener.
If you want to avoid a move, just apply this :

myMouseGesture = MouseDragGestureRecognizer.getMouseGesture(widget);
myMouseGesture.setDragMove(false);

Then on a onDragMouseMove listener, puts the function you need :

onDragMouseMove (Widget sender, int x, int y) {
myAbsolutePanel.setWidgetPosition( x , y );
}

detectDrop

public boolean detectDrop(int left,
                          int right,
                          int top,
                          int bottom,
                          com.google.gwt.user.client.Element w2)
Compares two widgets with the directs coordinates of the first one. (Improve performance and avoid to go look for DOM on a loop, for example)

Parameters:
left - the left coordinate of the first widget.
right - the right coordinate of the first widget.
top - the top coordinate of the first widget.
bottom - the bottom coordinate of the first widget.
w2 - the widget we want to compare with the coordinates.
Returns:
true if the two widgets are over, else false.

setWidgetPosition

public static void setWidgetPosition(com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget w,
                                     int left,
                                     int top)
The absolutePanel method, adapted for drag and drop. You can move a widget without having to call an inherit absolute panel. If you want to disallow this method, and drag a widget everywhere in a panel, simply put dragMove false.

Parameters:
w - the widget to position
left - the left coordinate
top - the top coordinate

Fired when the user depresses the mouse button over a widget.
This will fire all the events around this widget.

onMouseMove

public void onMouseMove(com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget sender,
                        int x,
                        int y)
Fired when the user moves the mouse over a widget.
This will fire the move, over and exit events of the drag and drop widgets.

onMouseUp

public void onMouseUp(com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget sender,
                      int x,
                      int y)

This will fire all the drop events, if two widgets are over.
